Name: Access Admin
Documentation: Life-cycle maintenance of identities and permissions.

Name: Access Certification
Documentation: Determining if the permissions granted to an entity are valid and follow directives such as Least Privilege.

Name: Access Control
Documentation: Runtime aspects of authentication, federation, and authorization.

Name: Adaptive Risk
Documentation: The ability to determine assurance levels or risk levels at runtime then adjust to levels.

Name: Administration
Documentation: The definition, creation, and maintenance of security models, groups, roles, and other access control constructs.

Name: Analytics
Documentation: Systematic evaluation and examination of data

Name: Analytics
Documentation: Systematic evaluation and examination of data

Name: Analytics
Documentation: Systematic evaluation and examination of data

Name: Anomaly Detection
Documentation: Analyzing behavior and patterns to determine if any action or events falls outside of what is normally expected.

Name: Anti-Spam
Documentation: Inspecting content, and sites to determine if they promote or contain unwanted or unsolicited e-mails or requests.

Name: Anti-Virus / Malware
Documentation: Inspecting content to determine if an executable has malicious intent directly or indirectly by modifying local systems.

Name: API Management
Documentation: Registration, deployment, scaling, and security for APIs

Name: Archiving
Documentation: Moving data to a less frequently accessed position, or medium

Name: Assurance
Documentation: The program, processes, or technologies that provide the required level of security related confidence.

Name: Authentication
Documentation: Positive identification of the claim that an entity is who they state they are.

Name: Authentication
Documentation: Positive identification of the claim that an entity is who they state they are.

Name: Authorization
Documentation: Determining if an entity has the requesting right to an action for a resource; if they have permission.

Name: Authorization
Documentation: Determining if an entity has the requesting right to an action for a resource; if they have permission.

Name: Backup
Documentation: To logically or physically map a copy of data in its current state

Name: Batch Processing
Documentation: Performing a series of collected operation as a  group

Name: BC/DR
Documentation: Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery.

Name: Boundary
Documentation: Security that defines and protects an area and the entry to that area

Name: Building
Documentation: Process that drive creating and testing solutions for eventual deployment

Name: Bulk
Documentation: Large dataset transfer or handling, may use specialized hardware or media

Name: Cache
Documentation: Ability to hold and distribute transactional data to increase performance or reduce backend processing

Name: Capability
Documentation: Undefined

Name: Capability
Documentation: Undefined

Name: Capability
Documentation: Undefined

Name: CDN
Documentation: Content Delivery Network, large scale distribution or global distribution of video, files, or static web content

Name: Cloud Access
Documentation: Determining and monitoring usage of cloud services along with the associated access control.

Name: Compliance
Documentation: The determination and statement of how well directives are being followed.

Name: Compliance
Documentation: The determination and statement of how well directives are being followed.

Name: Compliance Monitoring
Documentation: Inventory and check for proper software and hardware including configuration.

Name: Compute
Documentation: Computer-based calculation exposed through logical or physical means, can be extremely specialized services

Name: Configuration
Documentation: Inventory and determination of operational settings applied to hardware or software

Name: Containers
Documentation: Specialized form of virtualization that allows for ease of deployment and scaling

Name: Content Control
Documentation: Analysis of files, or containers whether at rest or in motion for presence of malicious intent.

Name: Cryptography
Documentation: General methods to protect data integrity or confidentiality.

Name: CyberSecurity
Documentation: Information security protection and assurance.

Name: Data Protection
Documentation: Protection processes and technologies for data at rest, data in transit, and data being processed.

Name: Data Protection
Documentation: Protection processes and technologies for data at rest, data in transit, and data being processed.

Name: Data Warehouse
Documentation: A large source of data collection from many sources

Name: Database
Documentation: A collection of data containers and maintenance types

Name: Dedicated
Documentation: A communication path set aside for a single purpose or by single users

Name: Deployment
Documentation: Managed installation or transfer of data or a system

Name: Detection
Documentation: Determine or identify the occurrence of a cybersecurity event

Name: Developer
Documentation: Set of abilities or services that can be used directly by the developer

Name: Development
Documentation: Tools and services for rapid creation of mobile applications

Name: Digital Signatures
Documentation: Service to provide a method for authenticity and integrity for messages or digital documents

Name: Directory
Documentation: Database that may contain identities, or users and related

Name: Directory
Documentation: Database that may contain identities, or users and related

Name: Disaster Recovery
Documentation: Storage used for restoration of business services after a disaster event

Name: Disk
Documentation: Storage optimized for physical or virtual compute devices (hard drives)

Name: DLP
Documentation: Data Loss and Prevention (or protection), system or process to monitor and protect unauthorized data from the protected areas

Name: DNS
Documentation: Domain Name Services, a directory and system for locating resources by name or address

Name: Document
Documentation: A database where the main element being managed is document oriented

Name: Edge Computing
Documentation: The ability to extend computing service to the device

Name: Email
Documentation: E-mail services that can be readily used by developers

Name: Encryption
Documentation: Set of services to provide integrity, and confidentiality to data

Name: Encryption
Documentation: Set of services to provide integrity, and confidentiality to data

Name: Entitlement
Documentation: Authorizations or permissions assigned to an entity

Name: Federation
Documentation: Use a trust between parties to provide authentication and authorization

Name: Firewall
Documentation: Detection and prevention of traffic flow based on packets info, protocol, address, and rules

Name: Firewall/IPS
Documentation: Detection and prevention of traffic flow based on packets info, protocol, address, and rules

Name: Forensics
Documentation: Process of controlled information collection criminal evidence

Name: Governance
Documentation: Process of directing and controlling security services

Name: HIDS/HIPS
Documentation: Host-based intrusion detection and/or protection system

Name: IAM Forensics
Documentation: Process of controlled information collection criminal evidence in the IAM space

Name: IAM Governance
Documentation: Process of directing and controlling IAM services

Name: Identity
Documentation: Electronic record representing an entity that is used for authentication and authorization

Name: Identity and Access
Documentation: Identity and Access Capability

Name: Incident
Documentation: A malicious or suspicious event

Name: Integration
Documentation: Combining or incorporating processes and information from multiple entities

Name: Intelligence
Documentation: Subset of artificial intelligence that deals with voice, image, and language processing

Name: IoT
Documentation: Internet of Things, services that support distributed internet connected devices

Name: IoT Dev
Documentation: Specific development processes for IoT devices

Name: Key Management
Documentation: Cryptographic secret management including symmetric and asymmetric keys

Name: Key-Value
Documentation: A database where the main element being managed is a collection of paired data items

Name: Listing and Filtering
Documentation: Whitelisting or blacklisting resources, or limiting resources based on rules

Name: Load Balancing
Documentation: Infrastructure service to distribute processing across resources, may also be used to provide availability of resources

Name: Logging
Documentation: Tracking and maintaining data over a period of time, event tracking

Name: Machine Learning
Documentation: A subset of artificial Intelligence that deals with learning through repetition or exposure

Name: Management
Documentation: Directing configuration and use of mobile devices

Name: Management and Ops
Documentation: Directing and maintaining runtime processing of people, resources, and processes

Name: MapReduce
Documentation: Large scale and parallel application of data processing and analytics

Name: Messaging
Documentation: Communication and event handling tools that can be integrated with applications and systems

Name: Migration
Documentation: Movement of data from one management platform, environment, or technology to another

Name: Mobile
Documentation: Services support the management and application development for mobile devices

Name: Mobile Device Management
Documentation: Hardware, software, and device management including configuration, control, and inventory

Name: Monitoring
Documentation: Observing the qualities of key resources and taking actions on those qualities if necessary

Name: NAC
Documentation: Network Access Control, rules based authentication and authorization for devices on a network

Name: Network and Delivery
Documentation: Network related services

Name: NIDS/NIPS
Documentation: Network Intrusion Protection and Prevention

Name: Object
Documentation: A database where the main element being managed is a object, whether binary or in some other format

Name: Orchestration
Documentation: Automated coordination of multiple tasks potentially across domains or platforms

Name: Patching
Documentation: Updating software or operating systems to remove vulnerabilities or reduce their likelihood

Name: PKI
Documentation: Public Key Infrastructure

Name: Policy
Documentation: A directive driving behavior supported by management, can be administrative or technical

Name: Privacy
Documentation: Keeping data, mainly an individuals, from unauthorized access

Name: Privileged Access
Documentation: Management of people and processes that have higher than normal permissions

Name: Provisioning
Documentation: Creating accounts, authorizations, assigning permissions and resources based on workflows and rules

Name: Proxy
Documentation: An agent or function that sits in front of an entity and represents it adding functionality to the represented entity

Name: Relational
Documentation: A database where the main elements being managed are tables/rows and ways those objects are connected

Name: Research/Intell
Documentation: Gathering and applying information to reduce or prevent security events

Name: Rights Management
Documentation: Protection of digital materials using cryptographic controls

Name: Search
Documentation: Highly scalable searching using artificial intelligence/machine learning to provide better results

Name: Security
Documentation: General services to provide integrity, availability, and confidentiality

Name: Security Event Management
Documentation: A centralized system for determining and reacting to security events

Name: Serverless
Documentation: Functional level processing is implemented without direct ties to platform, or hardware

Name: Speech
Documentation: Services to interpret speech process it using compute resources

Name: SSO
Documentation: Single Sign On, session based authentication that can span multiple systems without further interaction from the user

Name: Storage
Documentation: Services to maintain, accessed, and back up data

Name: Strategy
Documentation: Creating a plan for individual areas or departments to meet overall goals or objectives

Name: Streaming
Documentation: High volume event collection and processing from a large number of distributed devices

Name: Synchronization
Documentation: Keeping the changes the same for entities across multiple IAM repositories

Name: Testing
Documentation: Methodologies and tools to test implementation for functional and non-functional requirements

Name: Testing
Documentation: Methodologies and tools to test implementation for functional and non-functional requirements

Name: Threat and Vulnerability
Documentation: People, processes, and technology to identify, detect, and respond to exposure or potential exposure

Name: Training/Awareness
Documentation: Horizontal education that is sometimes mandatory

Name: Virtual
Documentation: Network or network subset based on configuration or software2

Name: Virtual Assistant
Documentation: Determining context, language, and interpretation of vocal requests using artificial intelligence or machine learning

Name: Virtual Servers
Documentation: Compute processing provided using software

Name: Visual
Documentation: Identifying or interpreting images through the use of a subset of artificial intelligence

Name: Visualization
Documentation: Analyzing results through sight, using diagrams, pictures, or graphics

Name: VPN
Documentation: Virtual Private Network, cryptographically secured communication between two points over a public network4

Name: VPN
Documentation: Virtual Private Network, cryptographically secured communication between two points over a public network4

Name: Vulnerability
Documentation: Processes and technologies to detect, remedy, or prevent exposure to being harmed

Name: WIDS
Documentation: Wireless Intrusion Detection, malicious intent detection for wireless communication

Name: Workflow
Documentation: Connecting multiple steps or processes together to complete a larger unit of work
